alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Berks, Lehigh, and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen is spots with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, Wilson, Nazareth, Kutztown, Hamburg, Slatington, Fleetwood, and Bath. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 59...and between mile markers 71 and 76. Northeast Extension between mile markers 54 and 71. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
